Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Odorranain-NR (Gly-rich; natural AMPs; UCSS1a; XXU; 1S=S, frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: isolated from skin secretions by chromatographic method.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (79.17%) toNigrocin-2GRaG: 26%; L: 17%, A: 13%. GRAVY: 1.039; mol Wt: 2139.611; mol formula: C93H163N27O26S2; mol ex coeff: 125 (from S-S bond).Activity: active against E.coli ATCC25922 (MIC > 100 ug/ml), B. dysenteriae (MIC 37.5 ug/ml),  S. aureus ATCC2592 (MIC 9.375 ug/ml), C. albicans ATCC2002 (MIC 18.750 ug/ml).Structure:  mainly beta sheet structure with and without SDS.MOA: appeared to depend on microorganism. directly killing S. aureus and C. albicans.In vitro toxicity: rabbit RBC: not hemo.lytic at 100 ug/ml.Updated 11/2024; 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Che Q, Zhou Y, Yang H, Li J, Xu X, Lai R. 2008
Literature Information.Title: A novel antimicrobial peptide from amphibian skin secretions of Odorrana grahami
